intro: Scuticaria itirapinensis, commonly known as the Itirapina scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the genus Scuticaria. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
